author: {'steamid': '76561199334126045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1710292884}
review: It's a great game but very simple. It makes you think and carefully plan what you do and its at your own pace, unlike other airline games which either require you to check in every so often or your stuck waiting for hours just for a plane to be built. This is a fast pace but simple management game. I also really enjoy the pass and play feature so I can locally play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028569808', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1682417121}
review: Fast and safe for travel long distance. Good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159352590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1599946624}
review: I thought this might be like the SNES game, Aerobiz, but it wasn't. It lacked the cultural depth of the original early 90's game AND the game mechanics really didn't make sense. There were not the world events that impact travel and its totally random. It's so random how flights are deemed profitable and changes randomly in  inexplicable ways. For example, a NY to London flight  might have extremely low numbers while a Denver to New Delhi flight is, for whatever reason, the most popular flight, until it isn't...and for no explained reason. It is just a trash game with little thought put into it.

review: Airline Director 2 - Tycoon Game - Airlines are Only Profitable if You Scrimp & Save in Every Aspect of the Management as Possible. You have to Adjust the Price Tickets regularly to be Competitive. To Be The Largest Airline in the World with the Most Profits You have to Be Aggressive in Quick Maximum Expansion. The Concept is to Only Travel to the Richest Cities in the World to be the Largest Airline in the World. It is a Difficult Game to Master. However, It is a Excellent Game that is Realistic and Enjoyable to Play and Learn. Highly Recommended. Enjoy.

review: The game needs quite some work but it's not all bad. The biggest flaw seems to be that there are consequences for making losses. The competition doesn't make money on most routes, however, this keeps going on. They should go bankrupt after a while. Also, an overview of your fleet would be nice. To replace a certain type, one has to click on every route until finding the right one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376600097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1627199007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083063302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1501052352}
review: One word - Pathetic.  As someone who has played virtually every airline simulation that has come down the pike, from Airbucks to Aerobiz Supersonic to Airlines 1 & 2, Airline Tycoon and many other PC based as well as online sims, this ranks as the worst hands down.  There is no strategy involved .. you just pick 2 cities and a plane (and the planes don't even have names - just a bunch of numbers and you have to figure out what they mean) and you try to match the number of seats per month to the demand.  Once a route is open, you cannot alter it in any way.  I never ask for refunds but this is a definite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962693751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1500716474}
review: Selbst für ein Handyspiel bietet es nicht genug Tiefe..

author: {'steamid': '76561198168901061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1613173056}
review: Ich kann gut verstehen, weshalb fast alle sagen, dass das Spiel nicht sein Geld Wert sei oder das es einfach nur Müll ist. Aber was ich seit meinen zig Stunden Spielzeit sagen kann ist, dass das was viele sagen nicht stimmt bzw das die nicht genau die Spielbeschreibung gelesen haben! Den klar das Tutorial erklärt einem eigentlich gar nichts und es sollte meiner Meinung nach verbessert werden bzw mehr erklären. Ich kann auch verstehen, dass alle über KI herziehen, die ich selber übrigends auch nicht so gut finde! Die KI ist an sich ganz gut, nur nach einiger Zeit, wenn fast alle Flughäfen von irgend einer Airline verbunden sind, braucht die KI schon gut 3 bis 6 Minuten, aber sie ist ansonsten top. Sie macht nachvollziehbare Routen und ist ansonsten gut. So und nun kommen wir dazu warum ich das Spiel Empfehle... Es ist ganz kurz gesagt. Es ist im Spiel alles enthalten, wie es in der Spielbeschreibung steht. Es gibt Errungenschaften die zum Teil leider meiner Meinung nach etwas zu schwer sind, aber es gibt welche. Dann gibt es viele verschiedene Flugzeugtypen, die man nach und nach freischaltet. (Hängt von der Zeit ab in der man gerade ist) Es gibt einen lokalen Multiplayer. (Bis zu 4 Spieler) Man kann zig Flughäfen bzw Städte verbinden und so viele Passagiere befördern. Daher kann ich zum Schluss sagen, dass man das Spiel kaufen kann, aber das Spiel auch nur das wirklich enthält was in der Beschreibung steht und auch nicht viel mehr! So und falls jetzt noch jemand Hilfe braucht, weil er das Spiel nicht ganz verstanden hat, der kann mich gerne Fragen und ich erkläre es so gut ich kann. Denn selbst ich weiß leider immer noch nicht genau wofür was ist, aber ich weiß definitiv mehr als das Tutorial erklärt! Also ich hoffe, ich konnte euch helfen einen besseren Einblick in das Spiel zu bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292798397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1707365276}
review:
I really like airline simulations: name it, i tried it. So i have tried the first game of the franchise, and it did have some really nice features and worked smoothly, and i thought a sequel could really make gameplay a bit more complete. And yes, they invented a few nice new features, but overall gameplay suffered because all those good things from the first part of the franchise were gone...

If you do get this game, small piece of advice: dont try setting up a big airline. By the time you have grown your airline big, you will pay more and more for your existing airplanes. so keep it light and small and update your airplanes every 2 to 3 years.... yes, annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064443202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1594104765}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086116497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1564795248}
review: So there were a lot of negative reviews before I got this game, but I remained optimistic and I bought it anyway. The game, in my opinion, is pretty good. For a $5 game, I'm actually impressed. It is a simple strategy/simulation game where you own an airline and you simply create flights between destinations that are in demand and try to make a profit. You choose between a bunch of airplanes to service your routes and you can also choose the quality of your flights, which is based on meals, crew size, and quality of the seats. The tutorial could have been better because it didn't tell me what any of the symbols that describe the airplanes specs mean, but it's pretty simple to figure out, from left to right: seats on the plane, cruising speed of the plane, maximum distance the plane can travel, and fuel consumption. All of these things along with meals, crew size, and quality of seats determine a routes "flight rating." Passengers tend to fly with the airline that has a higher "flight rating" and there are three other airlines that you have to compete with to try to have higher "flight ratings" in order to try to get as many passengers to fly with your airline. You start the game in 1960 and I think it goes on to 2009 (I say this because the game crashed for me at the end of 2009, and I'm not sure if that is suppose to signify the end or not). Again, for a $5 game, this is a good simulation/strategy game. I don't know what the other reviewers expected out of this game and how most of them came up with a review with less than an hour of gameplay, but I enjoyed it. It took me about 14 hours of playing time to go from 1960 to 2009.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022733849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1463668295}
review:
In this "business" game, money means nothing....
You don't need money to buy aircrafts, rent airport slots, set routes....
All you need is "moves" that assign to you 5 per-turn , whether you use it or not in your last turn.,.
And the money is nothing but outcome. you earn or lose money... and no effects except the number shown to you....

The game could be much more playable if you do things by using money rather than "moves" (maybe a celling moves as well, since is turn-based). IF DEVS FIX THIS, I'LL RECOMMEND IT.

The control, UI, database ect.. seems fine to me though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082862351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1463504012}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018094575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1462506094}
review: I must admit I am a fan of spread-sheet games.  I like getting into the information and numbers and figuring out how to make things work.  Having played some spread-sheet games in the past with a similar look to Airline Director 2, I thought that was what I was getting.  Not the case.  This is more of a clicker-style game.  Just set up new routes and let them make/lose money.  You don't have much to do beyond that & I quickly lost interest.  That being said,   I do see a nucleus  of possibilities within the game.  I don't recommend it at the moment, but will be keeping an eye on it to see if its potential can be realized.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042376587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1481258287}
review:
All these negative reviews for a game that costs less then a meal at McDonalds. The game is exactly what one would expect from such a low cost game. It is not one of these cash-grab type of strategy/sim game. In fact with some added and needed tool tips, expanded purchasing options, and a bit more flexibility it could be a really great simulation game.

The strategy involved is engaging, but you will have to play at least two times to grasp the concepts. Essentially, you are trying to figure out where to make the most money. When you have a market segment to yourself and no competition, you will do well. However, as the game progresses you begin competing with other companies for passengers along routes other carriers have. You will have to be smart, watch connecting flights, and be sure your planes are giving you a good rating. Additionally, sometimes the biggest planes aren't the best for certain routes. Sometimes multiple small planes will net you a larger sum of cash.

There is no tutorial worthy of mentioning. So you will be dropped into a game unsure how its components interact and unsure what the point of it all is. There is however an actual strategy to the game once you discover it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035101151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1462338236}
review: Кое как портированная игра с Андройда . Не берите только растроетесь...

author: {'steamid': '76561198039580878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1462737010}
review:
Pros:
-Pretend to be Michael O'Leary, shrink seats and make passengers pay for food!
-managing routes are simple open/adjust/close
-3D globe with planes whizzing about looks nice
-timeline with real plane introductory dates has concord and jumbos!
-dynamic economoy and limited orders keeps late game interesting
-good value +3hrs for <£3

Cons:
-poor tutorial
-AI which starts off strong, boost quality despite economy, gives up and all go into loss making spiral
-no multiplayer, hotseat mode, or play by email
-glitch on the operating profits where negatives do not show properly
-does not appear to be any win/loss conditions (maybe if I reach the present day?)
-hard to find quit, no manual save

author: {'steamid': '76561197993114712', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1462220494}
review:
Ich brech ins Essen,

ich habe es wirklich nicht für möglich gehalten, dass der Airport Simulator 2014 getoppt werden kann, aber meinen Glückwunsch, hier ist es:               

>> Das mit Abstand schlechteste Spiel in meinem Account <<

In den ersten 5 Minuten 2 Fe´s und einen Black Screen. Folglich eine neue Programmform der Mailware, sehr kreativ. 

Die schlechte Grafik wäre mir egal, wenn der Spiellfluss stimmen würde aber das Denken der KI macht bisher den Haupteil des Spieles aus. Absolut spannend: Sie denkt auf gefühlten 16-bit Niveau, vielleicht lerne ich ja noch etwas. Zumindest langsamer als ein altbackender Schulcomputer, da komme ich bestimmt noch mit. Auch die Beschleunigung bringt da nicht viel und muss für jede KI neu aktiviert werden. Naja klicken kann ich jetzt, vielleicht war das der gewünschte Lerneffekt seitens der Spieleentwickler.  

Weiterhin Routensteuerung verbuggt, kompliziert und unübersichtlich. Upgrade der Flugzeuge unmöglich, Bewertung der Routen bzw. Service-Menü der Airline nicht nachvollziehbar. Keine globale Finanzstatistik gefunden, außer imenser Strafen für zu alte Flugezeuge, welche man nicht upgraden oder durch Routenlöschung verschrotten kann. Völlig absurd und ich könnte darüber lachen, wenn ich gerade nicht schmollen würde, weil man mich über den Tisch gezogen hat.  

Da hätte ich mir lieber für das Geld kippen kaufen und wieder mit dem Rauchen angefangen sollen, da weiß ich wenigstens wofür ich meine Lebenszeit verbrennne. 

Kauft es Euch bitte nicht, auch wenn es nur 2-3 Euro kostet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031239120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1462159269}
review:
This game is fine, if you understand what you're getting. I dont need any instructions having played this back when it was called "AeroBiz" on SNES. Basically this is one of your grandads tycoon games and Ive been wanting a new one to come out for a long time. This isnt even as in depth as the SNES version and I hope they refine this ported update but for %$ or whatever its delivering exactly what it should, no more no less. I reccomend, all things considered and put my vote out there for something like this but even more in-depth, ala a paradox game perhaps. 

Google : areobiz SNES" if you cant figure out how to play. Their instrunction manual was about as in depth as this one and I figured out how to play it when I was 9 so....I have faith you can too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999816150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1563046415}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968632222', 'num_games_owned': 1660, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1461980833}
review:
100% Rubbish. 

Game gives you NO tutorial and just tells you to click a map a few times and then crashes. Terrible tablet graphics and horrid music. Stay away at all costs!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964222909', 'num_games_owned': 2623, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1462022778}
review:
Overall , I would really like to give this game a positive review, the idea is right , the overall concept of the game is good .. but you're left with an overwhelming void of where content should be. I played it way longer than I should have and i think i actually fell asleep with it running too. Heres a run down probably explaining better why people are hating so much on the game. 

Summary : Probably best to avoid in its current state unless heavily discounted or in an offsite bundle. 

+ Concept and game idea
+ Plenty of planes
+ ... 
+ Really wish I could put more here.

- Tutorial ( non-existant , see below)
- Map view shown with city names isn't in the game
- 'Competant AI' - Spreads like wildfire , making big profits early game, soon bankrupts self after
- ' AI is thinking ... ' even on fast forward, later on can take 30+ seconds / turn to decide
- Music loop gets quickly irratating ( same loop in the video ) 
- Only 153 cities? (Advertised 156)
- Economy either booms or goes into crisis ( Random event) 
- Turn based action points ( see below) 
- Leaderboards? Not implemented , links to achievements
- No campaigns, win/lose goals etc
- No Detailed information on profit / loss / routes etc ( expanded below) 
- So many useless plane models
- Planes are 'free' no research needed
- One type of plane / route ( can only send a max of 3x planes / route) 


... I wrote some follow up stuff but it didn't seem to post , so i posted in the discussion board instead - 
http://steamcommunity.com/app/462830/discussions/0/364040166678051154/

author: {'steamid': '76561198066689426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1490281397}
review:
Even though I have played this games for hours now, it's a rather disappointing game: 

* No manual - no documentation of planes, fuel efficiency, nor route recommendations
* Useless tutorial - to be fair, this game has probably the most useless tutorial ever
* Broken - I am currently the only airline who is not in debt. All the others are $200,000-$400,000 in debt, yet they are still able to continue to play? What's the point in being profitable? Due to this, the other airlines still dominate certain continents/areas with their hubs (and flying to a competitor's hub costs quite a lot)

Overall, this game is plane bad (pun intended). As the miserable person I am, I played this game too long to refund it, but please, until this game gets updated (in the good way), spare your pennies, and save it for something more useful, as this game will disappoint you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053971233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1461880369}
review:
Grauenhaft - dieses Wort umschreibt das Spielerlebnis ziemlich genau.
Was sich alles heutzutage "Tycoon"-Game nennt bzw. überhaupt nennen darf - das sollte man sich erstmal verdienen müssen.
Kommen wir zum Inhalt:

Vorteile:
- es startet
- es gibt immerhin 4 Speicherslots

Nachteile:
- keine Anleitung
- kaum bis keine Tooltips
- keine Simulation
- verbinde zwei Linien und gut ist - achja das nennt man dann Flugroute
...

Wer das Spiel holt - will wohl einfach mal nen Spiel haben wo man einen Globus sieht. :)

Gut das man sein Geld zurückbekommt bei weniger als 2 Std. Spielzeit und innerhalb von 14 Tagen.

....
....

99. .....
100. Remind me, someone, how do I refund this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198007243405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1466323436}
review:
Odotin tätä peliä pitkään ja se oli suosikkina Steam Green light. 
Peli alkaa vuodesta 1960 ja tuntuu kuin melkein olisimme siellä. Pelin mekaniikat ja grafiikat on todella kaukana tästä päivästä. Vuoropohjainen systeemi ei ole kovin innostava ja haastavuutta löytyy vain lapsille. Pelin kehittäjällä ei ole mitään käsitystä airline tyyppisistä peleistä. 
Peliin ei voi vaikuttaa mitenkään ja tärkeää olisi, jos hintoja voisi säätää, sekä koneita liisata/ostaa ja markkinoiden/henkilöstön hallinta.
Halusin tukea kotimaista kehittäjää ja ilmeisesti hänellä ei ole peliään kohtaan kunnianhimoa, kun heti alennuksella myydään.
Steamista saa edullisesti Early access pelejä, jotka on todella laadukkaita yhden hemmon tekeleitä ja olen niistä nauttinut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029818396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1461885644}
review:
[h1]Looks like a bad port from a phone game, bad tutorial[/h1]

This is comically bad.  There might be a game here, but the tutorial is so poorly implemented that you're left trying to figure out what seems like a fairly complex game with absolutely no guidance.  

After setting up five routes and less than a couple of minutes, your tutorial friend tells you "there's nothing left I can teach you" leaving you to figure out the vast majority of the game play and mechanics by yourself.

No exit button, have to back out to Windows and close from there.  

Poorly thoughout cash grab of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978629530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1461884727}
review: No manual. Useless tutorial. I guess there could be a strategy game in here somewhere but even some simple documentation to explain the screen, menus and concepts would be nice. Tired of developers putting out products and telling you to guess how to play, or watch utube videos. Lazy. Refund.
